--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
IMPORTANT CONSUMER DISCLOSURES & TERMS
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
PAYMENT TERMS: Payments are due within twenty-one (21) days of the statement 
date. Payments received after the due date will be subject to a late fee of 
1.5% of the total outstanding balance or $5.00, whichever is greater. To 
ensure proper credit, please include your account number on your check or 
money order and return the payment stub provided below.

DISPUTE RESOLUTION: If you believe there is an error on your bill, please call 
Customer Care at 1-800-555-0100. If we are unable to resolve the issue to your 
satisfaction, you have the right to file a formal complaint with the State 
Public Service Commission (PSC). You are not required to pay the disputed 
portion of the bill during the investigation; however, all undisputed charges 
must be paid by the due date to avoid service disconnection.

ESTIMATED BILLS: We make every effort to read your meter each month. If we are 
unable to access your meter due to weather, unrestrained pets, or locked 
gates, your bill will be estimated based on historical usage and current 
weather patterns. Any over- or under-billing will be reconciled during the 
next actual meter reading.

BILL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS: We offer several programs for customers facing 
financial hardship. The "Energy Equity Program" provides credits to low-income 
households. "Budget Billing" allows you to pay a fixed amount each month 
based on your annual average usage. Please contact our Billing Office to 
discuss eligibility.

ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT: The electricity provided in this billing cycle was 
generated from the following sources: Natural Gas (40%), Wind (22%), Nuclear 
(18%), Solar (15%), and Hydro (5%). Our corporation is committed to achieving 
a Net Zero carbon footprint by 2040. Your participation in the "Green Power" 
rider supports the development of local solar farms.

EMERGENCY INFORMATION: If you smell natural gas (an odor like rotten eggs), 
immediately leave the building and call our emergency hotline at 1-800-555-
9111 or dial 911. Do not operate light switches, use phones, or start 
vehicles in the area of a suspected leak. For water main breaks or power 
outages, visit our website outage map at www.metro-utility-corp.com/outages.

MUNICIPAL CODES: This bill includes charges mandated by City Ordinance 
88-412.3 regarding the maintenance of public sewage systems and the 
protection of local watersheds. Failure to pay municipal fees may result in a 
lien against the property or a referral to a third-party collection agency.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

- PHONE: Call our automated payment system at 1-888-555-4000 (Fees may apply).
- IN PERSON: Visit any authorized retail payment location or our main office.
- MAIL: Send a check to the address listed on the payment stub below.
